flow.descriptionCdata:
055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.02ebdb82-86bf-410c-bf61-a70988b7552e.description=This workflow returns the artifact's properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........ 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.05e9d70f-1e86-4bfc-8d26-b9c07b678605.prompt=Enter a value for followRedirects 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.071ca756-d34a-432d-8873-47559115744b.prompt=Enter a value for userAgent 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.153f2c99-dc0f-46eb-bb80-f378b58eac59.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.19a515dc-7f4d-47ad-b2da-7355a0282066.prompt=Enter a value for keystorePassword 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.1eb218e7-cecc-4e94-a1f5-5195b0f5a2b9.prompt=Enter a value for trustKeystore 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.3c421ecc-315a-41ea-b338-bb92c9753fdf.prompt=Enter a value for encodeURL 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.574e180c-31e3-412a-a3e4-989b6688e7dc.prompt=Process Instance ID 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.58f79bdf-8144-48f8-9286-b29991e23f91.prompt=User Identifier 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.5a9a1616-b1c8-4268-87be-1ea91e1ad047.prompt=Enter a value for socketTimeout 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.5e636a55-9b61-4372-8548-00220a7ca724.prompt=Enter a value for kerberosConfFile 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.6073c542-73b5-40e7-956c-9d2bec41d6a1.description=
Creates a new user in Active Directory

Input Parameters\:
host - domain controller
OU - the OU or CN to add the user too (i.e. CN\=Users)
userFullName - full name of user (Bob Smith)
userPassword - password for user (should respect the password restrictions imposed by AD)
sAMAccountName - login account name (bsmith)
altuser - user to connect to AD as
altpass - password to connect to AD as
escapeChars - add this input and set to true if you want the operation to escape the special AD chars.

Responses\:
success - created new user in AD
failure - failed to create user

Extra Results\:
userDN - the distinguished name of the newly created user

Notes\:
1. If the inputs contain special characters make sure you enter these inputs either with no special character escaped and set escapeChars to true, either with all the special characters escaped. The special AD characters are '\#','\=','"','<','>',',','+',';','\','"''.
2. If sAMAccountName input contains special characters these will be replaced with the "_" character. The following characters are considered special regarding sAMAccountName\: '"','\','/','[',']','\:',';','|','\=',',','+','*','?','<','>'.
055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.7623bf43-b341-4b29-b97b-dc28b3f973ca.prompt=Enter a value for proxyUsername 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.76c821d6-4793-4627-ab94-fb28c98500dc.prompt=Enter a value for trustPassword 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.7b7787d2-599b-4ba4-a3c2-3fbf042bb518.prompt=Enter a value for proxyPassword 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.7d32bc74-0d60-4e9b-994a-9ffe75287bd1.prompt=Enter a value for proxyPort 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.8a28d825-d5a5-4adf-adee-6985533859f2.prompt=Search Level\: 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.95965654-6625-457a-b080-b1d2f724a33e.description=
This workflow returns the user identifier id for the given user.

Inputs-
csaUser–  CSA User name
authType - The authentication type that this operation uses when trying to execute the request on the target server.
Valid values\: basic, form, digest, ntlm, kerberos, anonymous (no authentication).
Default value\: anonymous - authentication not used when executing the request.
kerberosConfFile - The path to the Kerberos configuration file. If this input is empty the kdc (Key Distribution Center) and realm will get their values from the full domain name which is obtained from the url of the web server.
timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for a connection to be established. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A timeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
socketTimeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for the data to be retrieved. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A socketTimeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
useCookies - If true, enables cookie tracking. Cookies will be stored between consecutive calls. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: true.
followRedirects - If true, the GET command automatically follows redirects. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: true
proxy - A proxy to use when accessing the web site.
proxyPort - The port on the proxy to connect to.
proxyUsername - The username to use when connecting to the proxy.
proxyPassword - The password to use when connecting to the proxy.
encodeURL - If true, automatically encodes the URL. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: false.
userAgent - The value that should be used if the HTTP header USER_AGENT has to be overridden.
trustAllRoots - If true, enables weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted CA issued it.
Default value\: true
keystore - URL of the keystore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS client authentication is not to be used.
keystorePassword - Password to unlock the keystore.
trustKeystore - URL of the truststore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS server authentication is not to be used.
trustPassword - Password to unlock the truststore.

Outputs-
userIdentifier – User identifier id for the given user
055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.af08d0e5-1105-4d4d-94b9-0b70a706cf89.description=
Searches for specific properties in LDAP. Returns a list of the values of the given properties for the first object that passes the filter (given in the corresponding input). The rest of the property values (for the other objects) are stored in a collection that is accessible via the LDAP Search Next Result operation.

Input Parameters\:
host - name or IP address of LDAP server to query. Can also be used in the form " host\:port"
dn - base DN for search
filter - search filter (see Note section)
propertyNames - names of properties to return (ex. distinguishedName,telephoneNumber)
username - name of user to connect to LDAP as
password - password of user
port - specify the port in case it is not the default one, or it is not specified in the host path
delimiter - a delimiter to separate the property names in the input and the property values in the result; if no value is assigned the delimiter is set to "," by default
useADAuth - add this input and set to false if using a non AD LDAP server. If false, uses ServerBind instead of secure NTLM based bind.
searchScope - the scope for doing the search. Permitted values\: Base -limits the search to the base object-, OneLevel -searches the immediate child objects of the base object, excluding the base object- or Subtree -searches the whole subtree, including the base object and all its child objects-. If the scope of a directory search is not specified, a Subtree type of search is performed. 

Responses\:
object(s) retrieved - was able to retrieve objects and property values from LDAP. First value returned as returnResult result
no objects found - no objects were found
failure - an invalid or duplicate property name was provided or an error occured. See returnResult for more information

Note\:
The filter input can be a simple filter, or a composed one. The filter can be composed by the rules described in "RFC2254 - The String Representation of LDAP Search Filters" which can be found at http\://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2254.html.  

Example of valid filters\:
member\=CN\=User1,CN\=Users,DC\=mydomain,DC\=local
(|(numsubordinates\=1)(entryid\=15))
(&(mobile\=*)(name\=abcd))
(&(objectClass\=Person)(|(sn\=Jensen)(cn\=Babs J*)))
055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.b2539d91-9f65-4887-8f70-0385d8a8eaed.description=
Adds a user to a group in Active Directory

Input Parameters\:
host - domain controller
groupDN - distinguished name of the group
userDN - distinguished name of the user to add
altuser - user to connect to AD as
altpass - password to connect to AD as

Responses\:
success - added user to group
failure - failed to add user to group
055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.b8cf01bc-33e0-42e5-906d-12ab9917b5c7.prompt=Search Level\: 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.ba54b02f-0a35-48e0-8196-71d3aa2c096d.description=
Searches for specific properties in LDAP. Returns a list of the values of the given properties for the first object that passes the filter (given in the corresponding input). The rest of the property values (for the other objects) are stored in a collection that is accessible via the LDAP Search Next Result operation.

Input Parameters\:
host - name or IP address of LDAP server to query. Can also be used in the form " host\:port"
dn - base DN for search
filter - search filter (see Note section)
propertyNames - names of properties to return (ex. distinguishedName,telephoneNumber)
username - name of user to connect to LDAP as
password - password of user
port - specify the port in case it is not the default one, or it is not specified in the host path
delimiter - a delimiter to separate the property names in the input and the property values in the result; if no value is assigned the delimiter is set to "," by default
useADAuth - add this input and set to false if using a non AD LDAP server. If false, uses ServerBind instead of secure NTLM based bind.
searchScope - the scope for doing the search. Permitted values\: Base -limits the search to the base object-, OneLevel -searches the immediate child objects of the base object, excluding the base object- or Subtree -searches the whole subtree, including the base object and all its child objects-. If the scope of a directory search is not specified, a Subtree type of search is performed. 

Responses\:
object(s) retrieved - was able to retrieve objects and property values from LDAP. First value returned as returnResult result
no objects found - no objects were found
failure - an invalid or duplicate property name was provided or an error occured. See returnResult for more information

Note\:
The filter input can be a simple filter, or a composed one. The filter can be composed by the rules described in "RFC2254 - The String Representation of LDAP Search Filters" which can be found at http\://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2254.html.  

Example of valid filters\:
member\=CN\=User1,CN\=Users,DC\=mydomain,DC\=local
(|(numsubordinates\=1)(entryid\=15))
(&(mobile\=*)(name\=abcd))
(&(objectClass\=Person)(|(sn\=Jensen)(cn\=Babs J*)))
055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.c07b6db0-958c-4524-a2c3-99a44ab6cd78.description=
Adds a user to a group in Active Directory

Input Parameters\:
host - domain controller
groupDN - distinguished name of the group
userDN - distinguished name of the user to add
altuser - user to connect to AD as
altpass - password to connect to AD as

Responses\:
success - added user to group
failure - failed to add user to group
055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.c3f037b2-1a99-473e-a063-220ad2de24e2.prompt=Enter a value for trustAllRoots 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.c5760722-f7ef-4100-8da4-aae1e9e3e943.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.c699b4c4-743c-441d-81ec-b8db4746100e.prompt=User Identifier 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.d6b33841-3926-413d-93a2-98e29eb5ef8c.prompt=Enter a value for authType 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.e735388a-6267-4681-8a2a-e5f35d09f3a6.prompt=Enter a value for timeout 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.eb5b80b0-7725-4460-b8a1-1f27b9ef48e6.prompt=Process Instance ID 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.ec706287-5b44-42ed-8d19-4cbf1e2cb14f.prompt=Enter a value for keystore 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.f3b06c57-b383-42d6-b7e2-3bde46885db6.prompt=Enter a value for proxy 055c7ec1-43c1-4b81-84ae-b387e18ee2e4.f7b1389c-73a7-429e-a627-5222556ced27.prompt=Enter a value for useCookies
flow.name: AD provisionning
